name: billyamericana
text: Of course, a Ray would be printed right over the top of a $100 bill with green ink made from processed marijuana. It would also have a button that when pressed would say "Yeah! We doin' THIS!" like those horrible greeting cards from my mom.

name: aarongstock
text: Agreed, except it'd be the six hundo bill.

name: tekende
text: I used to work at a bank. One time a customer cashed a rather large check and asked if I could give him bills in larger denomination than 100.

name: wazza
text: I believe there is in fact a $1000 bill which still counts as legal tender, but it is so rarely used that they don't bother to print it much.

name: lolsworth
text: Man I would have so much trouble spending that

name: rosie
text: I wonder what our clothing will look like to future generations in 100 years hence.

name: molesticide
text: probably what togas looked like to cowboys.

name: canusdivinus
text: People gonna be hella throwing on t-shirts and jeans for their frat parties in a few hundred years.

name: madnes
text: is SO correct.

name: centipede_damascus
text: Man, I wish I had a nice fitting three-piece suit. Those things are hell of expensive, and I don't have devil piano powers like Ray does.

name: tekende
text: They are expensive, and that is why I am fortunate that my dad's nice three-piece suit a) doesn't fit him anymore and b) fits me perfectly.

name: greenkoolayd
text: maybe theres a decent used one at your local goodwill, or other thrift store?  you could probably get it for less than a 20spot...

name: epicurus
text: I really love Twain's narration over the panels of Ray and Philippe doing their thing.

name: connellingus
text: In the future, people will spend heck of Smuckleses on clothing.

name: closefriend
text: In addition, "Smuckles" will be a slang term for "ducats" for the benefit of those who still say "hell of ducats."

name: rowboat
text: Who doesn't?

name: gournal
text: If you are rich like Ray you have Buckets of Ducats

name: tinhand
text: I think "heck of Benjamins" is one of my favourite phrases ever

name: honesttom
text:
Alt text: "Clothes make the man. Naked people have little or no influence in society. - Mark Twain"

This was obviously long before the Internet, so I suppose it was accurate back then.

name: pa_ass_nts
text: Times have changed, didn't the Governator run against 2 or 3 porn stars?

name: cailetshadow
text: He won, though.

name: relaxing
text: ...due mostly to his fame from wearing very little clothing.

name: dumase
text: Except for "heck of Benjamins," my favorite part is the silhouette of Phillipe in panel 3, because it makes me think he's expectantly looking out the window waiting for Santa Claus' triumphant birth.

name: aliiis
text: I want to give this two chubbies.

name: em2
text: This arc is the "Time's Arrow" of Achewood. I'm sorry if you get that reference. Please pass some of that pity back to me.

name: justa
text:
Twain had three daughters , but only one son -- who died of diptheria at 19 months old.

Dude is dressin' Ray in his dead kid's duds .

name: bixschmix
text: Hell of a spiffed-up tot, though.

name: fmercury
text: Or maybe he found the duds sealed in a bag in the toilet tank.

name: drago25
text: Hell of a outfit. I know the thong defines Ray, but daaamn, lookin' good.

name: milkpants
text: a wintering i go

name: d-pad
text: I must say, I'm actually shocked nobody's made and posted an image of Ray on some money. I may have to crack open Photoshop later this week and change this.

name: tekende
text: It's been seven months. Did you get busy that week?

name: i_love_kate
text:
God, did no-one notice Philippe silhouetted in the window in the third panel?

I am workink with such amateurs .

name: fineoakstructure
text: psst...hey, i_love_kate...check out dumase's comment above.

name: i_love_kate
text: Ctrl-f must have failed me that month. Hail mary, full of grace, how does your garden grow?

name: fictions
text: Seriously man
